meanings.definition: Progress or advancement, especially in gaining access or influence.
meanings.sent1: The company made significant inroads in the new market.
meanings.sent2: The team's inroads into the industry were well-received.
meanings.sent3: The inroads made by the rookie player surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her inroads into the field of science were groundbreaking.
meanings.sent5: The inroads of technology have transformed our daily lives.

meanings.sent1: The enemy forces launched inroads into the territory.
meanings.sent2: The inroads of the invaders were met with fierce resistance.
meanings.sent3: The inroads of the pranksters at the party caused chaos.
meanings.sent4: The inroads of the virus spread rapidly through the network.
meanings.sent5: The inroads of the storm left a path of destruction in its wake.

meanings.definition: A reduction or encroachment on something, such as market share.
meanings.sent1: The competitor's inroads into our market share were concerning.
meanings.sent2: The company's aggressive inroads affected our sales.
meanings.sent3: The inroads of the new product led to a drop in our profits.
meanings.sent4: The inroads of the discount store impacted our customer base.
meanings.sent5: The inroads of the rival company posed a threat to our business.
